methods.description:
Sets a new value for property filterList.

If set, the items of the list are filtered based on filterValue.

If a type-ahead behavior for the connected field is wanted, this property must be set to true. For small lists all values are meant to be shown, independent of the typing in the connected field. In this case this property must be set to false.

If not set, the list opens if the user clicks into the connected field.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is true.

methods.name: setUseFirstMatch

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bUseFirstMatch
parameters.description: New value for property useFirstMatch

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property useFirstMatch.

If set, getKeyForText returns the first item that matches the text.

This is the case if the text of the item starts with the text entered.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is false.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.FilterBar
symbols.description:
The FilterBar control is used to display filter properties in a user-friendly manner to populate values for a query. The filters are arranged in a logical row that is divided depending on the space available and the width of the filters. The Go button triggers the search event, and the Advanced Filters button shows the filter dialog.
The FilterBar control creates and handles the filters based on the provided metadata information. The metadata information is provided via the FilterBarDelegate implementation. This implementation has to be provided by the application.

Specifies the personalization options for the filter bar.

symbols.description: The FilterBarBase control is used as a faceless base class for common functionality of any MDC FilterBar derivation.

properties.name: _filterCount
properties.description: Binds the text of the Adapt Filters button.

properties.name: delegate
properties.description:
Defines the path to the metadata retrieval class for the FilterBarBase control. It basically identifies the FilterBarDelegate file that provides the required APIs to create the filter bar content.
Note: Ensure that the related file can be requested (any required library has to be loaded before that).
Note: This property must not be bound.

Since: 1.74.

properties.name: filterConditions
properties.description:
Specifies the filter conditions.
Note: This property must not be bound.
Note: This property is used exclusively for SAPUI5 flexibility. Do not use it otherwise.

Since: 1.66.0.

properties.name: liveMode
properties.description:
Triggers a search automatically after a filter value has been changed.
Note: The liveMode property only operates in non-mobile scenarios.
Additionally, if the liveMode property is active, the following applies:
The error message box is not displayed, and the showMessages property is ignored.

Since: 1.74.

properties.name: propertyInfo
properties.description:
Specifies the filter metadata.
Note: This property must not be bound.
Note: This property is used exclusively for SAPUI5 flexibility/ Fiori Elements. Do not use it otherwise.

Since: 1.97.

properties.name: showGoButton
properties.description:
Determines whether the Go button is visible in the filter bar.
Note: If the liveMode property is set to true, it is ignored.

properties.name: showMessages
properties.description:
Displays possible errors during the search in a message box.

Since: 1.74.

properties.name: suspendSelection
properties.description:
If set to true, all search requests are ignored. Once it has been set to false, a search is triggered immediately if one or more search requests have been triggered in the meantime but were ignored based on the setting.

Since: 1.79.0.

aggregations.name: basicSearchField
aggregations.description: Contains the optional basic search field.

aggregations.name: filterItems
aggregations.description: Contains all the displayed filter fields of the FilterBarBase control.

aggregations.name: layout
aggregations.description: Internal hidden aggregation to hold the inner layout.

associations.name: variantBackreference
associations.description: VariantManagement control for the filter bar. Note: this association is only required, for being able to get information from SAPUI5 Flexibility whenever a variant was applied, with 'apply automatically' set to true. Note: this association may only be assigned once.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: initial settings for the new control

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new FilterBarBase.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

events.name: filtersChanged

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.filterbar.vh.FilterBar
symbols.description:
The FilterBar control is used to display filter properties in a user-friendly manner to populate values for a query. The filters are arranged in a logical row that is divided depending on the space available and the width of the filters. The Go button triggers the search event, and the Show Filters button shows the additional filter field.
The FilterBar control creates and handles the filters based on the provided metadata information. The metadata information is provided via the FilterBarDelegate implementation. This implementation has to be provided by the application.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.FilterField
symbols.description: The FilterField control is used to filter data based on the conditions. The conditions are managed in the corresponding ConditionModel. That is why the conditions property must be bound to the related conditions in the ConditionModel. The type of this data must be defined in the dataType property.

properties.name: defaultOperator
properties.description:
Default operator name for conditions. If empty, the relevant default operator depending on the data type used is taken.

Note: defaultOperator can be the name of an Operator or the instance itself.

Since: 1.88.0.

properties.name: operators
properties.description:
Supported operator names for conditions.

If empty, default operators depending on used data type are used.

Since: 1.73.0.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: Initial settings for the new control

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new FilterField.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The new value of the control

parameters.name: valid
parameters.description: Flag that indicates if the entered value is valid

parameters.name: conditions
parameters.description:
Conditions of the field. This includes all conditions, not only the changed ones.

Since: 1.61.0.

parameters.name: promise
parameters.description:
Returns a Promise for the change. The Promise returns the value if it is resolved. If the change event is synchronous, the promise has already been already resolved. If it is asynchronous, it will be resolved after the value has been updated.

The FilterField should be set to busy during the parsing to prevent user input. As there might be a whole group of fields that needs to be busy, this cannot be done automatically.

Since: 1.69.0.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.IFilter
symbols.description:
Interface for controls or entities which can serve as filters in the sap.ui.mdc.Table & sap.ui.mdc.Chart.

The following methods need to be implemented:

  • getConditions - Part of the sap.ui.mdc.IFilterSource interface.
  • validate - The validate method should return a promise which resolves after the IFilter interface has handled its inner validation. The getConditions method will be called subsequently by the filtered control.
  • getSearch - Note: The getSearch method can optionally be implemented and should return a string for approximate string matching implemented in the backend.

The following events need to be implemented:

  • search - This event should be fired once a filtering should be executed on the IFilter using control.
  • filtersChanged - Note: The filtersChanged event can optionally be implemented and should be fired whenever a filter value has changed. This event will be used to display an overlay on the IFilter consuming control.
symbols.title: interface sap.ui.mdc.IFilter

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.Link
symbols.description:
A Link control can be used to handle navigation scenarios with one or more targets through direct navigation or by opening a Panel.
It can also be used to display additional content, such as ContactDetails on the Panel. Note: Navigation targets are determined by the implementation of a sap.ui.mdc.LinkDelegate.

Do not bind or modify the module. Once the required module is associated, this property might not be needed any longer.

nodes.name: sap.ui.mdc.mixin.AdaptationMixin
nodes.description: Enhances a given control prototype with consolidated handling for adaptation.

nodes.name: sap.ui.mdc.mixin.DelegateMixin
nodes.description: Enhances a given control prototype with consolidated asynchronous handling for delegate modules and their initialization.

nodes.name: sap.ui.mdc.mixin.FilterIntegrationMixin
nodes.description:
Enhances a given control prototype with consolidated handling for external IFilter integration

The following methods are available:

  • setFilter - The setter for the filter association
  • _validateFilter - Validates the provided IFilter control instance and may return an error
  • rebind - Executes a the rebind method for the given control instance.

To use the FilterIntegrationMixin, the implementing Control requires the filter associaton.

Additionally, the following methods are necessary to be implemented:

  • _rebind
  • isFilteringEnabled

Hooks that are called by the FilterIntegrationMixin if implemented in the control.

  • _onFilterProvided(oFilter: sap.ui.mdc.IFilter) - Notifies the control that a valid filter association has been provided. The provided filter instance is passed.
  • _onFilterRemoved(oFilter: sap.ui.mdc.IFilter) - Notifies the control that the filter association has been removed. The removed filter instance is passed.
  • _onFiltersChanged(oEvent) - Called when the search event of the filter is fired. The event object is passed.
  • _onFilterSearch(oEvent) - Called when the filtersChanged event of the filter is fired. The event object is passed.

nodes.name: sap.ui.mdc.mixin.PromiseMixin
nodes.description: Enhances a given control prototype with a management mechanism for lifecycle related promises.

nodes.name: sap.ui.mdc.mixin.PropertyHelperMixin
nodes.description:
Enhances a given control prototype with consolidated asynchronous handling for providing a PropertyHelper

The following methods are available:

  • initPropertyHelper - Loads and initializes the property helper related to the enhanced control.
  • awaitPropertyHelper - Provides access to the property helper initialization Promise.
  • finalizePropertyHelper - Finalizes the propertyHelper fetching all available propertyInfo via a given control delegate.
  • isPropertyHelperFinal - Indicates if the propertyHelper for this control allready contains all available propertyInfo.
  • getPropertyHelper - Returns the property helper instance, if available.

Additionally, the following methods are wrapped:

  • applySettings
  • exit
  • init

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.mixin.AdaptationMixin
symbols.description:
Enhances a given control prototype with consolidated handling for adaptation.

The following methods are available:

  • getEngine - Provides access to the adaptation engine singleton instance.
  • retrieveInbuiltFilter - Provides access to the AdaptationFilterBar initialization
  • getInbuiltFilter - Returns the AdaptationFilterBar instance, if available.
  • getAdaptationConfigAttribute - Returns an adaptationConfig attribute.

Additionally, the following methods are wrapped:

  • exit
symbols.title: namespace sap.ui.mdc.mixin.AdaptationMixin

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.mixin.DelegateMixin
symbols.description:
Enhances a given control prototype with consolidated asynchronous handling for delegate modules and their initialization.

The following methods are available:

  • awaitControlDelegate - Provides access to the delegate initialization Promise.
  • getControlDelegate - Returns the delegate instance, if available.
  • getPayload - Returns the payload object set for the delegate property.
  • getTypeUtil - Returns the typeUtil made available by the delegate module
  • initControlDelegate - Loads and initializes the delegate module related to the enhanced control.
  • initPropertyHelper - Loads and initializes the property helper related to the enhanced control.
  • awaitPropertyHelper - Provides access to the property helper initialization Promise.
  • getPropertyHelper - Returns the property helper instance, if available.

Additionally, the following methods are wrapped:

  • applySettings
  • exit
  • init
  • setDelegate

The prototype.init wrapper creates the following instance fields:

  • bDelegateInitialized - Indicator for the availability of delegates
  • bDelegateLoading - Indicates whether the initialization of delegate modules is triggered but not yet completed (loading necessary)

The following methods are available:

  • rebind - Executes a the rebind method for the given control instance.

To use the FilterIntegrationMixin, the implementing Control requires the filter associaton.

Additionally, the following methods are necessary to be implemented:

  • _rebind

Hooks that are called by the FilterIntegrationMixin if implemented in the control.

  • _onFilterProvided(oFilter: sap.ui.mdc.IFilter) - Notifies the control that a valid filter association has been provided. The provided filter instance is passed.
  • _onFilterRemoved(oFilter: sap.ui.mdc.IFilter) - Notifies the control that the filter association has been removed. The removed filter instance is passed.
  • _onFiltersChanged(oEvent) - Called when the search event of the filter is fired. The event object is passed.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.MultiValueField
symbols.description: A MultiValueField control can hold multiple values. The values are stored as items. A MultiValueField control can be used to bind its items to data of a certain data type. Based on the data type settings, a default control is rendered by the MultiValueField control.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.p13n.StateUtil
symbols.description: Utility class for state handling of MDC controls. The StateUtil class is offering a generic way to retrieve states and set a desired state for a given MDC control. The StateUtil class is tightly coupled to the SAPUI5 flexibility integration of MDC controls. To use the APIs of Stateutil, the given MDC control instance needs to fully enable all available p13nMode options. This way, Stateutil can create the required changes and retrieve the relevant state of each control.

methods.name: sap.ui.mdc.p13n.StateUtil.applyExternalState

returnValue.description: Promise that resolves after all changes have been applied

parameters.name: oControl
parameters.description: The control that is used to create changes and to which changes are made

parameters.name: oState
parameters.description: The state in which the control is represented

methods.description:
Creates and applies the necessary changes for a given control and state. Note:The changes are created in the same order as the objects are passed into the state object attributes. For example, by adding two objects into the items attribute of the oState object, the first entry is created, and the second entry is created on top of the first change. The item state is applied for each provided object in the given order in the array and uses the provided position. If no index or only an invalid index has been provided, the item is added to the array after the last item in the affected control's item aggregation. In addition the following attributes can be used to remove a state:

  • sorted - Set to false in the sorters scope to remove a sorter/code>.
  • grouped - Set to false in the groupLevels scope to remove a grouping.
  • visible - Set to false to remove an aggregation item.
  • aggregated - Set to false to remove an aggregation.

Note:To improve the performance, you should avoid additional calls of the control’s delegate. To do this, the propertyInfo property of the relevant control can be enriched with the properties used in the provided state.

examples.data:
Example: 

oState = {
		filter: {
			"Category": [
				{
					"operator": EQ,
					"values": [
						"Books"
					]
				}
			]
		},
		items: [
			{name: "Category", position: 3},
			{name: "Country", visible: false}
      ],
      sorters: [
			{name: "Category", "descending": false},
			{name: "NoCategory", "descending": false, "sorted": false}
      ],
		groupLevels: [
			{name: "Category"},
			{name: "Country", grouped: false}
      ],
		aggregations: {
			Region: {},
			Country: {
				aggregated: false
			}
		},
		//The supplementaryConfig can be used to modify control specific attributes, for example the column width in the Table
		supplementaryConfig: {
			aggregations: {
				columns: {
					Category: {
						width: "150px"
					}
				}
			}
		}
}

properties.name: enableAutoColumnWidth
properties.description:
Enables automatic column width calculation based on metadata information if set to true. The column width calculation takes the type, column label, referenced properties, and many other metadata parameters into account. Providing a more precise maxLength value for the String type or precision value for numeric types can help this algorithm to produce better results. The calculated column widths can have a minimum of 3rem and a maximum of 20rem.

Note: To customize the automatic column width calculation, the visualSettings.widthSettings key of the PropertyInfo can be used. To avoid the heuristic column width calculation for a particular column, the visualSettings.widthSettings key of the PropertyInfo must be set to null. This feature has no effect if the width property of the column is bound or its value is set.

Since: 1.95.

properties.name: enableColumnResize
properties.description:
Determines whether column resizing is enabled.

Since: 1.90.

properties.name: enableExport
properties.description:
Determines whether the table data export is enabled.

Since: 1.75.

properties.name: enablePaste
properties.description:
Determines whether the Paste button is enabled.

Since: 1.96.

properties.name: filterConditions
properties.description:
Defines the filter conditions.

Note: This property must not be bound.
Note: This property is used exclusively for handling SAPUI5 flexibility changes. Do not use it otherwise.

Since: 1.80.0.

properties.name: groupConditions
properties.description:
Defines the group conditions.

Note: This property must not be bound.
Note: This property is used exclusively for handling SAPUI5 flexibility changes. Do not use it otherwise.

Since: 1.87.

properties.name: header
properties.description: Header text that is shown in the table.

properties.name: headerLevel
properties.description:
Semantic level of the header. For more information, see sap.m.Title#setLevel.

Since: 1.84.

properties.name: headerVisible
properties.description:
Determines whether the header text is shown in the table. Regardless of its value, the given header text is used to label the table correctly for accessibility purposes.

Since: 1.63.

properties.name: height
properties.description: Height of the table.

properties.name: multiSelectMode
properties.description:
Defines the multi-selection mode for the control. If this property is set to the Default value, the ResponsiveTable type control renders the Select All checkbox in the column header, otherwise the Deselect All icon is rendered.

This property is used with the selectionMode="Multi".

Since: 1.93.

properties.name: noDataText
properties.description:
Determines the text shown if the table has no data.

Since: 1.63.

properties.name: p13nMode
properties.description:
Personalization options for the table.
Note: The order of the options does not influence the position on the UI.

Since: 1.62.

properties.name: selectionMode
properties.description: Selection mode of the table. Specifies whether single or multiple rows can be selected and how the selection can be extended. It may also influence the visual appearance.

properties.name: showPasteButton
properties.description:
Determines whether the Paste button is visible.

Since: 1.91.

properties.name: showRowCount
properties.description:
Determines whether the number of rows is shown along with the header text. If set to false, the number of rows is not shown on the user interface.
Note:
For better performance dedicated OData requests should not be sent. The count mode must be configured either in the model or in the binding of the table.
This property can only be used if the back-end service supports row count.

properties.name: sortConditions
properties.description:
Defines the sort conditions.

Note: This property must not be bound.
Note: This property is used exclusively for handling SAPUI5 flexibility changes. Do not use it otherwise.

Since: 1.73.

properties.name: threshold
properties.description:
Number of records to be requested from the model. If the type property is set to ResponsiveTable, then it refers to the growingThreshold property of ResponsiveTable. If the type property is set to Table, then it refers to the threshold property of GridTable.
Note: This property only takes effect if it is set to a positive integer value. Otherwise the table uses the default value of the corresponding table types.

Since: 1.63.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Width of the table.

aggregations.name: actions
aggregations.description: Additional/external actions available for the table.

aggregations.name: columns
aggregations.description: Columns of the table.

aggregations.name: creationRow
aggregations.description: This row can be used for user input to create new data if TableType is "Table". Note: Once the binding supports creating transient records, this aggregation will be removed.

aggregations.name: dataStateIndicator
aggregations.description:
DataStateIndicator plugin that can be used to show binding-related messages.

Note: The message filtering is not yet supported for this control. Therefore the enableFiltering property of the DataStateIndicator plugin must not be set to true.

Since: 1.89.

aggregations.name: quickFilter
aggregations.description: Additional Filter for the table.

aggregations.name: rowSettings
aggregations.description:
Settings for the table rows.

Note: Each time the properties of the settings are changed, they have to be applied again via setRowSettings for the changes to take effect.

aggregations.name: type
aggregations.description: Type of the table.

aggregations.name: variant
aggregations.description: VariantManagement control for the table.

associations.name: filter
associations.description: Control or object which enables the table to do filtering, such as sap.ui.mdc.FilterBar. Also see sap.ui.mdc.IFilter.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: Optional ID for the new control; generated automatically if no non-empty ID is given Note: The optional ID can be omitted, no matter whether mSettings is given or not.

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: Object with initial settings for the new control

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new MDCTable.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

events.name: beforeExport

parameters.name: exportSettings
parameters.description:
Contains workbook.columns, dataSource, and other export-related information.

Note: The exportSettings parameter can be modified by the listener. Thus the parameter can be different if multiple listeners are registered which manipulate the parameter.

parameters.name: userExportSettings
parameters.description: Contains the export settings defined by the user.

events.description:
This event is fired right before the export is triggered.

For more information about the export settings, see sap.ui.export.Spreadsheet or Spreadsheet Export Configuration.

Since: 1.75.

parameters.description: The index of the row that is to be focused

parameters.name: bFirstInteractiveElement
parameters.description: Indicates whether to set the focus on the first interactive element inside the row

methods.description: Sets the focus on the row. If bFirstInteractiveElement is true, and there are interactive elements inside the row, sets the focus on the first interactive element. Otherwise sets the focus on the first data cell, if the type is GridTableType, and on the entire row, if the type is ResponsiveTableType. If the given index is not visible, the table scrolls to it automatically. In this case the same rules apply as in #scrollToIndex.

methods.description: Scrolls the table to the row with the given index. Depending on the table type, this might cause additional requests. If the given index is -1, it will scroll to the end of the table based on the length of the underlying binding. If the length is not final, it will only scroll to the end of the current binding and might trigger a request for additional entries. This also applies in case of a responsive table with growing enabled.

Do not bind or modify the module. Once the required module is associated, this property might not be needed any longer.

methods.name: setEnableAutoColumnWidth

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bEnableAutoColumnWidth
parameters.description: New value for property enableAutoColumnWidth

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property enableAutoColumnWidth.

Enables automatic column width calculation based on metadata information if set to true. The column width calculation takes the type, column label, referenced properties, and many other metadata parameters into account. Providing a more precise maxLength value for the String type or precision value for numeric types can help this algorithm to produce better results. The calculated column widths can have a minimum of 3rem and a maximum of 20rem.

Note: To customize the automatic column width calculation, the visualSettings.widthSettings key of the PropertyInfo can be used. To avoid the heuristic column width calculation for a particular column, the visualSettings.widthSettings key of the PropertyInfo must be set to null. This feature has no effect if the width property of the column is bound or its value is set.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is false.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.table.ResponsiveTableType
symbols.description: The table type info class for the metadata-driven table.

properties.name: detailsButtonSetting
properties.description:
Defines which columns are hidden instead of moved into the pop-in area depending on their importance. See sap.m.Column#getImportance and sap.m.Table#getHiddenInPopin for more details.

Note: To hide columns based on their importance, it's mandatory to set showDetailsButton="true".
If no priority is given, the default configuration of sap.ui.mdc.table.ResponsiveTableType#getShowDetailsButton is used.
If this property is changed after the Table has been initialized, the new changes take effect only when the Show / Hide Details button is pressed a second time.

Since: 1.86.

properties.name: growingMode
properties.description: Specifies the growing mode.

properties.name: popinLayout
properties.description:
Defines the layout in which the table pop-in rows are rendered.

Since: 1.96.

properties.name: showDetailsButton
properties.description:
Specifies whether the Show / Hide Details button for the ResponsiveTable scenario is shown.

If the available screen space gets too narrow, the columns configured with High and Medium importance move to the pop-in area, while the columns with Low importance are hidden.
On mobile phones, the columns with Medium importance are also hidden.
As soon as the first column is hidden, this button appears in the table toolbar and gives the user the possibility to toggle the visibility of the hidden columns in the pop-in area.

Since: 1.79.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.table.RowSettings
symbols.description: The RowSettings control is used to configure a row. This control can only be used in the context of the sap.ui.mdc.Table control to define row settings.

properties.name: highlight
properties.description:
The highlight state of the rows.

If the highlight is set to sap.ui.core.MessageType.None (default), no highlights are visible. Valid values for the highlight property are values of the enumerations sap.ui.core.MessageType or sap.ui.core.IndicationColor.

Accessibility support is provided through the associated highlightText property. If the highlight property is set to a value of sap.ui.core.MessageType, the highlightText property does not need to be set because a default text is used. However, the default text can be overridden by setting the highlightText property. In all other cases the highlightText property must be set.

properties.name: highlightText
properties.description: Defines the semantics of the highlight property for accessibility purposes.

properties.name: navigated
properties.description:
The navigated state of a row.

If set to true, a navigation indicator is displayed at the end of the row.

aggregations.name: rowActions
aggregations.description:
The available actions for a row.

rowActions cannot be bound with a factory. Additionally, sap.m.Table only works with row actions of type navigation.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: Optional ID for the new object; generated automatically if no non-empty ID is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: Initial settings for the new control

constructor.description:
Constructor for new RowSettings.

Caution: Only use bindings which are bound against the rows, as working functionalities cannot be ensured for other binding types.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

Accessibility support is provided through the associated highlightText property. If the highlight property is set to a value of sap.ui.core.MessageType, the highlightText property does not need to be set because a default text is used. symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.util.PromiseCache
symbols.description: Provides a caching mechanism for promises. This API features Promise cancellation: resolve or reject handlers won't be called after removal of the promise, cache destruction or manual cancellation. Destroying the cache will cancel all registered promises and delete references. Convenience methods for promise creation, wrapping and replacement are offered.

methods.name: add

returnValue.description: Returns the newly created Promise

parameters.name: sName
parameters.description: Promise identifier

parameters.name: fnCreate
parameters.description: creation method or pre-created promise

methods.description:
Adds a promise to the promise cache using a string identifier and a creation method or given Promise. Calling add using an already existing identifier will cancel and replace the existing promise.

Note: All unsettled promises will be cancelled on removal or cache destruction A given creation method will receive the following arguments on execution:

  • oPromise ­- The newly created Promise
  • fnResolve ­- Resolve method for the newly created Promise
  • fnReject ­- Reject method for the newly created Promise
  • fnRemove ­- Remove method for the newly created Promise

methods.name: cancel

returnValue.description: Returns the canceled Promise

parameters.name: vPromise
parameters.description: Promise or identifier

methods.description: Cancels an unsettled promise from the promise cache. Calling cancel twice is a no-op.

methods.name: clear
methods.description: Provides cleanup functionality for the promise cache

methods.name: destroy
methods.description: Provides cleanup functionality for the promise cache

Retrieves an existing promise from the promise cache. Automatically creates and returns a new promise if fnCreate is given.

A given creation method will receive the following arguments on execution:

  • oPromise ­- The newly created Promise
  • fnResolve ­- Resolve method for the newly created Promise
  • fnReject ­- Reject method for the newly created Promise
  • fnRemove ­- Remove method for the newly created Promise

properties.name: name
properties.description: Unique, stable key for the property. It must only contain characters allowed for IDs, see sap.ui.core.ID. Does not have to be an existing attribute in the data model or the technical name of an attribute in the data model.

properties.name: path
properties.description: The technical path for a data source property.

properties.name: label
properties.description: Translatable text that labels the property.

properties.name: visible
properties.description: Whether the property is or can be visible to a user.

properties.name: propertyInfos
properties.description: The availability of this property makes PropertyInfo a complex PropertyInfo. Provides a list of related properties (by name). These related properties must be no complex PropertyInfo to avoid deep nesting.

properties.name: typeConfig
properties.description: Object which contains type-specific information about the property, especially the type instance (for example, for model filter creation in Table rebind).

properties.name: extension
properties.description: Reserved attribute. Must not be provided by the delegate directly as part of the PropertyInfo, but separately in the fetchPropertyExtensions method of the delegate. The PropertyInfoExtension is a key-value map where the key is the property name and the value is the additional information. The structure of the additional information depends on the delegate. Used to add model-specific information. For example, for analytics in OData, see sap.ui.mdc.odata.v4.TableDelegate.

symbols.description: Element for the FieldHelp association in the FieldBase controls.

properties.name: _config
properties.description: internal configuration

properties.name: _valid
properties.description: Internal property to allow to bind the valid state to OK Button or make it available for all content controls

properties.name: conditions
properties.description:
The conditions of the selected items.

Note: This property must only be set by the control the ValueHelp element belongs to, not by the application.

Note: A condition must have the structure of ConditionObject.

properties.name: delegate
properties.description:
Path to the Delegate module that provides the required APIs to execute model-specific logic.
Note: Ensure that the related file can be requested (any required library has to be loaded before that).
Do not bind or modify the module. This property can only be configured during control initialization.

properties.name: filterValue
properties.description:
The value by which the help is filtered.

Note: This only takes effect if the ValueHelp elements content supports filtering.

Note: This property must only be set by the control the ValueHelp element belongs to, not by the application.

properties.name: validateInput
properties.description:
If this property is set, the user input of the corresponding field is validated against the value help. If no entry is found for the user input, an error is shown on the field.

If this property is not set, the user input is still checked against the value help. But if no entry is found, the user input is set to the field if the used data type allows this. (A type parsing error is shown if the user input adheres to the requirements of the used data type.)

aggregations.name: dialog
aggregations.description: Container that is used and opened if the value help icon of the input field is pressed.

aggregations.name: typeahead
aggregations.description: Container that is used and opened in typeahead

Gets current value of property validateInput.

If this property is set, the user input of the corresponding field is validated against the value help. If no entry is found for the user input, an error is shown on the field.

If this property is not set, the user input is still checked against the value help. But if no entry is found, the user input is set to the field if the used data type allows this. (A type parsing error is shown if the user input adheres to the requirements of the used data type.)

Default value is true.

Note: This function must only be called by the control the ValueHelp element belongs to, not by the application.

Determines if the value help should be opened when something is typed into the field.

Opening the value help must be triggered by the control the ValueHelp element belongs to.

Note: This function must only be called by the control the ValueHelp element belongs to, not by the application.

methods.name: isValidationSupported

returnValue.description: True if value help can be used for input validation

methods.description: Defines if the value help can be used for input validation.

methods.name: navigate

parameters.name: iStep
parameters.description: Number of steps for navigation (e.g. 1 means next item, -1 means previous item)

methods.description:
Triggers navigation in the value help.

Note: This function must only be called by the control the ValueHelp element belongs to, not by the application.

methods.name: onControlChange
methods.description:
Triggers some logic that must be executed in ValueHelp element if a Change event on the connected control is fired.

This is done if the corresponding control value is changed (not during navigation).

Note: This function must only be called by the control the ValueHelp element belongs to, not by the application.

methods.name: open

parameters.name: bTypeahead
parameters.description: Flag that determines whether value help is opened for type-ahead or for complex help

methods.description:
Opens the value help for the control to which the ValueHelp element is connected.

Note: This function must only be called by the control the ValueHelp element belongs to, not by the application.

methods.name: removeFocus
methods.description: The focus visualization of the field help needs to be removed as the user starts typing into the field.

methods.name: setConditions

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: sConditions
parameters.description: New value for property conditions

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property conditions.

The conditions of the selected items.

Note: This property must only be set by the control the ValueHelp element belongs to, not by the application.

Note: A condition must have the structure of ConditionObject.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is [].

methods.name: setDelegate

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oDelegate
parameters.description: New value for property delegate

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property delegate.

Path to the Delegate module that provides the required APIs to execute model-specific logic.
Note: Ensure that the related file can be requested (any required library has to be loaded before that).
Do not bind or modify the module. This property can only be configured during control initialization.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is ...see text or source.

methods.name: setDialog

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oDialog
parameters.description: The dialog to set

methods.description: Sets the aggregated dialog.

methods.name: setFilterValue

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: sFilterValue
parameters.description: New value for property filterValue

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property filterValue.

The value by which the help is filtered.

Note: This only takes effect if the ValueHelp elements content supports filtering.

Note: This property must only be set by the control the ValueHelp element belongs to, not by the application.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is empty string.

methods.name: setTypeahead

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oTypeahead
parameters.description: The typeahead to set

methods.description: Sets the aggregated typeahead.

methods.name: setValidateInput

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bValidateInput
parameters.description: New value for property validateInput

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property validateInput.

If this property is set, the user input of the corresponding field is validated against the value help. If no entry is found for the user input, an error is shown on the field.

If this property is not set, the user input is still checked against the value help. But if no entry is found, the user input is set to the field if the used data type allows this. (A type parsing error is shown if the user input adheres to the requirements of the used data type.)

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is true.

methods.name: shouldOpenOnClick

returnValue.description: If true, the value help should open when user clicks into the connected field control

methods.description:
Determines if the value help should be opened when the user clicks into the connected control.

Opening the value help must be triggered by the control the ValueHelp element belongs to.

Note: This function must only be called by the control the ValueHelp element belongs to, not by the application.

methods.name: skipOpening
methods.description:
Skips the opening of the value help if it is pending because of loading content.

Note: This function must only be called by the control the ValueHelp element belongs to, not by the application.

methods.name: toggleOpen

parameters.name: bTypeahead
parameters.description: Flag that determines whether value help is opened for type-ahead or for complex help

methods.description:
Toggles the open state of the value help.

Note: This function must only be called by the control the ValueHelp element belongs to, not by the application.

methods.name: valueHelpEnabled

returnValue.description: true if value help is enabled, false if only typeahead is enabled

methods.description: If only typeahead is enabled the field should not show a value help icon or open the value help using F4.

// Example configuration:
	{
		'sap.ui.mdc.valuehelp.MyCustomContainer': {
			showArrow: true,
			showHeader: true,

			getContentWidth: function () { return "500px"; },

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.valuehelp.base.FilterableListContent
symbols.description: Content for the Container element.

properties.name: descriptionPath
properties.description: The path of the description field in the content binding. If a table is used as content, this is the binding path of the description of the items.

properties.name: filterFields
properties.description:
The fields based on which the table data is filtered. For filtering the value of the filterValue property is used.

If set to $search and the used binding supports search requests, a $search request is used for filtering.

If set to one or more properties, the filters for these properties are used for filtering. These filters are set on the ListBinding used. The properties need to be separated by commas and enclosed by "*" characters. ("*Property1,Property2*")

If it is empty, no suggestion is available.

properties.name: keyPath
properties.description:
The path of the key field in the content binding. If a table is used as content, this is the binding path of the key of the items.

If not set, the FieldPath of the assigned field is used.

aggregations.description: Default FilterBar, ceated internally if none given.

properties.name: caseSensitive
properties.description:
If this property is set to true, the filtering for user input is always case-sensitive. Otherwise user input is checked case-insensitively. If $search is used, this property has no effect on the $search request.

If the used back-end service supports a case-insensitive search, set this property to false.

properties.name: useAsValueHelp
properties.description: If set, the List is also opened if the ValueHelp icon is pressed.

properties.name: useFirstMatch
properties.description:
If set, getKeyForText returns the first item that matches the text.

This is the case if the text of the item starts with the text entered.

aggregations.name: inParameters
aggregations.description:
Sets the in parameters of a field help.

If set, the field help reads the data of these entities in the model and uses it to filter in the value help.

aggregations.name: outParameters
aggregations.description:
Sets the out parameters of a field help.

If set, the fields sets the data of these entities in the model based to the selected values.

If a type-ahead behavior for the connected field is wanted, this property must be set to true. For small lists all values are meant to be shown, independent of the typing in the connected field. In this case this property must be set to false.

If not set, the list opens if the user clicks into the connected field.

properties.name: groupable
properties.description: If set, the items of the list can be grouped

aggregations.name: items
aggregations.description:
Items of the field help.

The key of the items is not shown in the list, but is used as a value of the connected field.

If the additionalText for all the items is not used, the column will not be displayed.

Note: At the moment, icons are not supported.

parameters.name: oConfig
parameters.description: Configuration

parameters.description: Value as entered by user

parameters.description: Value parsed by type to fit the data type of the key

parameters.description: BindingContext of the checked field. Inside a table the ValueHelp element might be connected to a different row.

parameters.description: If set, the value help checks first if the value fits a key // TODO: not longer needed?

parameters.name: checkKey
parameters.description: If set, the value help checks only if there is an item with the given key. This is set to false if the value cannot be a valid key because of type validation.

parameters.name: checkDescription
parameters.description: If set, the field help checks only if there is an item with the given description. This is set to false if only the key is used in the field.

parameters.description: Name of the ConditionModel, in case of FilterField

The value help checks if there is an item with a key or description that fits this value.

As this could be asyncronous as data might be loaded a promise is returned.

nodes.name: sap.ui.mdc

nodes.name: sap.ui.mdc.enum.BaseType
nodes.description:
Enumeration of the possible basic data types

In Field and FilterField different data types can be used. This data types might be model dependent. To handle them model independent internally basic types are used.

nodes.name: sap.ui.mdc.enum.ConditionValidated
nodes.description:
Enumeration of the validated state of conditions

If a Condition is chosen from a field help or validated against a field help it is set to be validated. In this case the corresponding item in the field help is shown as selected.

If the validated state of the Condition is undefined this means it is not defined if it is validated or not.
